question: Adenosine deaminase (enzyme) deficiency is associated with:
exp: SCID- defect in common gamma chain of IL2 receptor along with IL-4, 7 2nd M/C defect is -ADA deficiency total absence of T and B cell deficiency of PNP (purine nucleoside phosphorylase) X-linked agammaglobulinemia/ bruttons agamma globulinemia- defect in B tyrosine kinase gene pro B cell to pre B cell formation defect Transient hypogammaglobulinemia- delayed onset of normal IgG synthesis, self limiting. Chronic granulomatous disease- deficiency of NADPH oxidase. led to reccurent catalase positive infection eg.:-staph.

question: Causative organism of tropical spastic paraparesis is?
exp: Tropical spastic paraparesis(TSP) is a disease of the spinal cord caused by Human T cell lymphotropic virus(HTLV). Alternate names: HTLV associated myelopathy, chronic progressive myelopathy. Paraparesis is a characteristic feature. Other features include uveitis, ahritis, alveolitis, polymyositis, keratoconjunctivitis sicca and infectious dermatitis.

question: Chediak higashi syndrome, defect is-
exp: Chediak higashi syndrome -Defective phagolysosomal fusion leading to decrease in melanocytes Severe Combined Immunodeficiency- Deficiency of Purine Nucleoside Phosphorylase Chronic Mucocutaneous Candidiasis- T cell disorder leading to recurrent candidiasis X linked Hyper IgM Syndrome- Deficiency of CD40 Ligand on activated T cell
